section_1_key_concepts.overview: Graphs allow us to visualise algebraic relationships. This topic covers plotting coordinates, straight line graphs (y=mx+c), and interpreting real-life graphs.
learning_objectives: Plot coordinates in all four quadrants
Recognise, sketch and interpret graphs of linear functions
Use the form y = mx + c to identify parallel lines
Find the equation of a line through two points

key_terms.definition: Where the line crosses the y-axis (c)

section_2_detailed_explanations.heading: Linear Graphs (y = mx + c)
section_2_detailed_explanations.content: This is the equation of a straight line. 'm' is the gradient (steepness). 'c' is the y-intercept (where it cuts the y-axis). Positive 'm' goes uphill, negative 'm' goes downhill.
key_points: m = change in y / change in x
Parallel lines have the same gradient

foundation.question: What is the gradient of y = 3x + 2?
foundation.explanation: In y=mx+c, m is the coefficient of x.
